Package: sk.hax.software.os.command

[Groovy] Class Rtaskd

    • sk.hax.software.os.command.Rtaskd
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      Task

      class Rtaskd

      Remote task daemon (rtaskd). Listens on the specified port for incoming connection requests (in form of a datagram with empty data). If it receives a connection request, creates a task instance specified by the second argument, and provides a pseudoterminal slave to it. Then, it forwards any further data received from the same address and port to the pseudoterminal master, effectively sending it as input to the created task. Likewise, any output from the created task received through the pseudoterminal master is sent back through the network to the source address and port. This way, any interactive task may be published as a network service on a port.

      Authors:
      mio

      • Method Detail

        • protected int determinePort()

          Determine the port number to listen for connection requests on. This taken from the first startup argument of the task.

          Returns:
          port number to listen on

        • protected java.lang.Object determineTaskClass()

          Determine the class of the task to create upon a connection request. The algorithm to determine the class first looks for the task definition on the storage. It tries to find it there using the second startup argument combined with the current working directory. If it does not succeed, it tries to find the task by qualified name.

          Returns:
          class of the task to be created upon a connection request, null if it cannot be constructed

        • java.lang.String help()

          Gets the help page for this task. Used by the HaxOS help system.

          Returns:
          help page text

        • void receiveData(Datagram datagram)

          Processes data received from the network. If a connection exists for the source address and port, the data is simply forwarded to the respective pseudoterminal master. If no connection exists, a new pseudoterminal and task instance are created and the task is started. The new task instance is injected the REMOTEADDRESS and REMOTEPORT properties with the address and port from the incoming connection request.

          Parameters:
          datagram - received datagram

        • void sendData(Datagram datagram)

          Processes data received from a child task through the pseudoterminal master. If the data is empty, it is considered a connection close request and the connection is terminated. Otherwise, the data is forwarded to the respective destination network address and port.

          Parameters:
          datagram - data received from the child task, wrapped in a datagram with address and port correctly set

        • @java.lang.Override void start()

        • @java.lang.Override void stop()

        • @java.lang.Override java.lang.String toString()
